news.headline: Qumulo introduces Cloud Data Fabric, offers global file system for efficient computing & collaboration.
news.summary: Seattle-based company Qumulo, Inc. has introduced the Cloud Data Fabric, a revolutionary global file system that oversees all enterprise data. This technology boasts a unique coherent cache at the edge, facilitating instant access and concurrent global collaboration. The Qumulo Cloud Data Fabric serves as a unified platform for an organization's data, operating seamlessly across data centers and cloud environments. By doing so, it propels efficient accelerated computing and broadens data accessibility beyond traditional protocol or transport limitations.

news.headline: Totino's Pizza Rolls debuts Big Game ad with Tim Robinson and Sam Richardson in "Chazmo Finally Goes Home" commercial.
news.summary: In Minneapolis, Totino’s Pizza Rolls is set to launch their debut Big Game commercial titled “Chazmo Finally Goes Home” just before the football event. The ad showcases the comedic pair Tim Robinson and Sam Richardson bidding goodbye to Chazmo, their pizza roll enthusiast extraterrestrial friend. Scripted by Zach Kanin (known for “I Think You Should Leave” and “Detroiters”) and directed by Alice Mathias (from “I Think You Should Leave”), this anticipated commercial will be a hit among viewers.

news.headline: Weather Channel app introduces probabilistic snowfall feature for premium users, offering visual snowfall probabilities for informed decision making. ATLANTA, Feb. 5, 2025.
news.summary: Harnessing extensive data collections, the latest function offers users visual representations of the likelihood of snowfall. This empowers individuals to make informed decisions regarding winter weather activities, whether it's planning commutes or deciding on school closures. The feature was launched on February 5, 2025, by The Weather Channel mobile app.

news.headline: ETH weakens as BTC hits $100,000, Hyperliquid benefits. ETH: $3,900 → $2,800. HYPE rising, ETH losing value to BTC due to capital rotation.
news.summary: Ethereum (ETH) has shown a concerning trend of weakness recently, with Hyperliquid (HYPE) benefiting from this dynamic. Lookonchain and crypto analyst kirbyongeo pointed out the divergence in performance between Ethereum and Hyperliquid compared to Bitcoin’s (BTC) movement towards $100,000. When Bitcoin first reached $100,000, Ethereum's price was $3,900, but with subsequent hits to six figures, ETH's value decreased: $3,800 → $3,700 → $3,400 → $3,200 → $2,800. This indicates Ethereum consistently losing value against BTC, likely due to capital shifting to Bitcoin or other assets. In contrast, Hyperliquid has been experiencing an upward trend or maintaining its value amidst this situation.

news.headline: USAA provides over $1B in payments to members affected by California wildfires, with 86% of claims paid. Supporting military community during challenging times.
news.summary: In San Antonio, USAA, a top financial services provider for the military community, is dedicated to helping members impacted by the California wildfires. Currently, 86% of wildfire claims have been given initial payments, totaling over $1 billion distributed to members. Randy Termeer, USAA Property and Casualty President, emphasized the organization's strong commitment to assisting members during these difficult circumstances.

news.headline: Fed's Barkin: There are jobs out there that had been devalued, that have been revalued up because of scarcity.
Higher Images, aiding small businesses for 25+ years, unveils new leadership with Linda Jo Thornberg as President, setting goals for 2025.
news.summary: Linda Jo Thornberg has been appointed as the President of Higher Images. Thornberg will be taking on the leadership role at the company, bringing her wealth of knowledge and experience to the position. This move comes as Higher Images aims to capitalize on Thornberg's skills to drive growth and success. With this new appointment, Higher Images anticipates significant advancements under Thornberg's leadership.

news.headline: Foremost Clean Energy's spin-out closing date changed to January 31, 2025. Shareholders get 1 new Foremost share and 2 Rio Grande shares for each Foremost share held.
news.summary: Foremost Clean Energy Ltd. is spinning out its gold and silver properties into a new company called Rio Grande Resources Ltd. The effective date of this spin-out has been delayed by a day and is now set for January 31, 2025, at 12:01 a.m. Vancouver time. Shareholders of Foremost as of January 30, 2025, will receive one new Foremost Share and two Rio Grande Shares for each Foremost Share they hold. This spin-out is part of a plan of arrangement and marks Foremost's focus on uranium and lithium exploration.

news.headline: TILT Holdings to sell two dispensaries in Massachusetts for $2 million to In Good Health, aligning with strategic goals.
news.summary: TILT Holdings Inc., a leading global cannabis solutions provider, has recently declared the signing of an Asset Purchase Agreement to sell two dispensaries in Massachusetts. This move is in line with the company's strategy to consider strategic options for its plant-related operations and enhance the value of its vape hardware business, Jupiter Research. TILT is known for its diverse cannabis business solutions encompassing inhalation technologies, cultivation, manufacturing, processing, brand development, and retail services. The company's stocks are listed as Cboe CA:TILT and OTCQB: TLLTF.

news.headline: Trump aims to cancel new labor agreements with federal workers signed by Biden admin in a bid to invalidate "last-minute, lame-duck" deals - White House memo.
news.summary: According to a memo from the White House, an order has been issued to prevent the signing of any last-minute agreements by the Biden administration during the lame-duck period.

news.headline: Beyond acquiring rights to Buy Buy Baby brand, to unite it with Bed Bath & Beyond, including parent company.
Pro Football Legend Jerome Bettis raises awareness on hypertension's impact on Black adults with CDC. Hypertension a leading cause of cardiovascular deaths; often undiagnosed due to lack of symptoms.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, in Atlanta, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) stated that unregulated high blood pressure is a primary factor in the deaths related to cardiovascular diseases. The CDC highlights that a significant number of individuals are unaware of their elevated blood pressure status as it often presents no noticeable symptoms. This lack of awareness poses a serious health risk, as untreated hypertension can lead to severe health complications.

news.headline: Fed holds rates steady at 4.25%-4.5%. Experts warn against interest rate cut until June, if at all, as Fed's policy turns more hawkish. Inflation remains somewhat elevated.
news.summary: The Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday that they are maintaining interest rates in the range of 4.25% to 4.5%, after implementing three consecutive rate cuts starting in September. Economists are observing a slight shift towards a more hawkish stance in the Fed's policy statement since the word "progress" was removed. The latest statement acknowledged that "Inflation remains somewhat elevated," contrasting the previous acknowledgment of inflation progressing towards the Committee's 2% target but still persisting at elevated levels. This adjustment reflects experts' views on the Federal Reserve's future trajectory. For more details on the evolving situation, the full article is accessible on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Bitcoin hits over $104,000 as Fed Chair Powell supports cryptocurrency, praising Congress for regulatory efforts. Stocks struggle due to AI trade concerns.
news.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell surprisingly showed support for cryptocurrencies during a press conference, stating that banks can provide services to crypto customers as long as they manage risks. This marks a shift from his previous anti-crypto stance, emphasizing a pro-innovation approach. Powell also commended Congress for working on clearer regulatory frameworks, suggesting stronger oversight would benefit industry and financial stability. Bitcoin's value rose 3% to over $104,000 following the news. Meanwhile, Wall Street struggled amid concerns about the AI trade.

news.headline: Executive Home Care franchisees have won the 2025 Best of Home Care® Awards for outstanding service. #EviveBrands #SeniorCare.
news.summary: In Scottsdale, Arizona on February 5, 2025, Executive Home Care, a top provider of in-home care services for seniors and those in need under Evive Brands, revealed that multiple franchise sites have been honored with the esteemed 2025 Best of Home Care® award.

news.headline: PetDesk unveils PetDesk Scribe AI tool for veterinary note-taking, enhancing efficiency. Launch soon.
news.summary: In San Diego on February 5th, 2025, PetDesk, a prominent company offering technology for veterinary client communication, shared news about its latest innovation: PetDesk Scribe. This advanced AI-driven note-taking solution is set to revolutionize the current manual process. The company aims to streamline operations with this cutting-edge technology.

news.headline: Trump criticizes Fed for handling inflation, vows to combat it if elected. Fed holds rates steady at 4.25%-4.5%. Trump pledges regulatory cuts to unleash lending for American people and businesses.
news.summary: On Wednesday, President Donald Trump criticized the Federal Reserve for its handling of inflation and banking regulation following their decision to maintain interest rates at 4.25%-4.5%. In a post on Truth Social, Trump promised to address inflation by increasing energy production and cutting regulations if he is elected. He disapproved of the Fed's focus on climate initiatives and diversity programs. This critique came after the Federal Open Market Committee kept rates steady, ending a series of three cuts that began in September. Trump expressed his dissatisfaction with the Fed's bank regulation policies and vowed that his administration would facilitate more lending for Americans and businesses through regulatory reforms led by the Treasury.

news.headline: Copado now supports DevOps for Salesforce Data Cloud, boosting Agentforce workflows. Chicago-based, announced on Feb 5, 2025.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, in Chicago, Copado, a prominent DevOps provider for business applications, unveiled its latest offering: extensive DevOps assistance for Salesforce Data Cloud implementations. This update allows companies to enhance the efficiency of developing and launching Agentforce solutions. With this support, organizations can now better streamline their processes and maximize their Salesforce Data Cloud deployments.

news.headline: AleAnna, Inc. to mark their public listing with NASDAQ bell-ringing ceremony, signaling contribution to Europe's energy sector with low carbon solutions.
news.summary: AleAnna recently achieved a significant milestone by advancing Europe's access to secure and sustainable energy, while also taking the lead in transitioning to low-carbon energy solutions. By playing a pivotal role in this transition, AleAnna is contributing to the region's energy security and environmental sustainability. This achievement underscores AleAnna's commitment to providing reliable and sustainable energy sources for Europe.

news.headline: Datasea pre-announces Q2 revenue of $20.5M, up 81% YoY. Gross profit saw a 310% increase YoY.
news.summary: Datasea Inc. (Nasdaq: DTSS), a digital technology company based in Nevada, reported a significant year-over-year increase in Gross Profit, reaching a remarkable 310%. Specializing in acoustics high-tech and 5G+AI multimodal digital innovations, the company made this announcement on February 5, 2025.

news.headline: Dow Jones rises, Powell mentions tariff uncertainty. Waiting for Tesla, Microsoft, Meta earnings.
news.summary: Stocks on the Dow Jones index experienced a slight increase in the stock market today as investors eagerly anticipated Federal Reserve Chairman Powell's upcoming statements and the earnings reports from three prominent technology companies. The market saw a positive shift as Powell acknowledged uncertainty surrounding tariffs under the Trump administration. The imminent earnings releases of Tesla, Microsoft, and Meta also played a significant role in the market's activity. The rise in the Dow Jones index indicates a sense of cautious optimism among investors amidst these events.

news.headline: Dow Jones plunges on Trump tariff; Apple, Nvidia drops. Fed's inflation gauge rises 0.3% monthly, 2.6% annually.
news.summary: In recent economic news, the personal consumption and expenditures index, which is the Federal Reserve's favored measure of inflation, saw a 0.3% increase from the previous month and a notable 2.6% increase on a yearly basis. Meanwhile, in today's stock market activity, the Dow Jones experienced a significant decline following President Trump's tariff order. Tech giants like Apple and Nvidia broke crucial levels, while MicroStrategy made noteworthy moves. For more live coverage, stay updated with the latest updates from Investor's Business Daily.

news.headline: Frankspeech Network, Inc (rebranded as Mike Lindell Media Corp.) names Cara Castronuova as Chief White House Correspondent.
news.summary: In Washington, D.C., on January 23, 2025, FrankSpeech Network, Inc ("FSBN"), undergoing rebranding as Mike Lindell Media Corp., revealed Cara Castronuova's appointment as Chief White House Correspondent. Joining FSBN and LindellTV in their Washington, D.C. News Media Division, Ms. Castronuova will cover White House news comprehensively. FSBN expressed confidence in Ms. Castronuova's ability to provide unique perspectives from within the White House, differing from traditional media outlets.

news.headline: Fed kept rates unchanged at 4.25% to 4.5% after 3 cuts in 2024. Poll shows Tesla most impacted by decision.
news.summary: After three consecutive rate cuts in 2024, the Federal Reserve decided to maintain the federal funds rate at 4.25% to 4.5% in January. This decision followed a total reduction of 100 basis points. The Magnificent Seven stocks, representing some of the largest global companies, may be impacted by this decision as lower interest rates can stimulate economic growth and make borrowing more affordable. The results of a Benzinga reader poll on which stock could be most affected by the rate decision showed Tesla Inc. at 39%, NVIDIA Corporation at 30%, Amazon.com Inc. at 9%, Microsoft Corporation at 9%, Apple Inc. at 8%, Meta Platforms at 5%, and Alphabet Inc. at 0%. This reflects investor sentiments on how the decision could affect these leading companies.

news.headline: USPS will still receive packages from Hong Kong and China despite the order for increased inspection of parcels.
news.summary: Despite a recent executive order mandating increased scrutiny of packages, the Postal Service has announced it will still be accepting parcels from Hong Kong and China. The order aims to enhance security measures by introducing more rigorous inspections of incoming packages. This decision by the Postal Service means that shipments from these regions will not be affected, maintaining the flow of goods between the United States and Hong Kong/China. This move comes as a reassurance to businesses and individuals who rely on international shipping, ensuring continued service despite the heightened security protocols.

news.headline: ClarityPay secures $1 billion capital purchase program from Neuberger Berman. Finance for consumer solutions.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, ClarityPay, a company offering consumer finance solutions to businesses, revealed a capital purchase program worth as much as $1 billion. This program is supported by funds overseen by Neuberger Berman's Specialty Finance group, experts in asset-based finance. ClarityPay's partnership with Neuberger Berman's Specialty Finance group marks a significant development in their efforts to provide financial solutions to merchants.

news.headline: Gary Gensler delivered a cautionary message to Washington before leaving office.
Panama Canal fees spike amid controversy over alleged overcharging, with increases linked to drought, maintenance, demand.
news.summary: President Trump has criticized the canal authority for allegedly overcharging, with recent fee hikes reportedly linked to factors such as drought conditions, maintenance expenses, and higher demand.

news.headline: IRCODE introduces LIVE+: new standard for real-time interaction in sports, media. Launch includes integration into broadcasts, advertising, and commerce.
news.summary: In Houston on February 5, 2025, IRCODE introduced LIVE+, a revolutionary technology reshaping the landscape of live sports and interactive media. This new feature aims to incorporate instantaneous interactivity into live transmissions, advertisements, and e-commerce.

news.headline: Silexion Therapeutics to raise $3.3M through exercise of warrants. Proceeds for general corporate purposes.
news.summary: On January 29, 2025, Silexion Therapeutics Corp. (NASDAQ: SLXN) revealed plans to exercise outstanding warrants for the purchase of up to 2,221,523 ordinary shares at $1.35 per share. The warrants were issued in January 2025 and are registered under Form S-1 (No. 333-282932). The company expects gross proceeds of about $3.3 million from the exercise, excluding fees and expenses. The offering is set to close around January 30, 2025, pending standard closing conditions. Silexion Therapeutics intends to utilize the net proceeds as working capital for general corporate needs.

news.headline: Trump promised aggressive trade policy changes but has not taken any action so far.
news.summary: After making numerous promises, Donald Trump pledged to overhaul U.S. trade policy upon returning to the White House.

news.headline: Stocks recover after DeepSeek's AI impact. Fed holds rates at 4.25%–4.5%. Trump imposes 25% tariffs on Canada, Mexico. Nvidia loses 15%.
news.summary: In just four trading sessions, the U.S. stock market swiftly recovered most of the losses suffered earlier in the week after Chinese startup DeepSeek introduced a more efficient and cost-effective AI platform than OpenAI’s ChatGPT, leading to a sharp decline on Wall Street. This prompted investors to question the need for investing in higher-cost AI companies, causing top chipmakers and data center stocks to plummet. However, strong quarterly earnings reports and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s less hawkish stance compared to December encouraged bullish sentiment, resulting in a market rebound. In line with expectations, the Federal Reserve maintained interest rates at 4.25%–4.5%. Powell surprisingly hinted at potential future rate cuts, describing current monetary policy as "meaningfully restrictive." Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ: NVDA) suffered, dropping approximately 15% over the week and declining further on Friday following additional reports.

news.headline: Dow Jones Futures drop as Trump announces tariff hikes vs. Canada, Mexico, and China. Amazon, Google, and Palantir stocks fall before earnings.
news.summary: President Trump has approved tariffs against Canada, Mexico, and China, with plans for more in the future. The Dow Jones Futures have taken a significant dip in response to this decision. Earnings reports for Amazon, Google, and Palantir are imminent and are expected to have an impact on their stock prices.

news.headline: Major financial institutions have joined the 'debanking' trend.
Several countries, including US allies, making trade deals as Trump's administration implements tariffs.
news.summary: Several nations, including allies of the United States, are increasingly signing trade agreements amidst the Trump administration's tightening of global trade policies.

news.headline: Beyond Oil expands to France, driving global strategy forward with first agreement in the country.
news.summary: The initial agreement in France marks a milestone in the expansion beyond oil for a global growth strategy, with a significant impact on the European market and beyond. This landmark deal is set to revolutionize the industry landscape, with substantial numerical benefits being expected. The agreement positions the company as a key player in reducing dependence on oil, with projections indicating noteworthy growth in the coming years. This development sets a precedent for sustainable practices and strategic diversification in the energy sector.

news.headline: Montage Partners bestows Values Award on Equity Methods for embodying core values. Commitment to excellence recognized.
news.summary: A private equity firm based in Scottsdale, Arizona, Montage Partners, recently introduced its inaugural Values Award, with Equity Methods being honored as the first recipient. The award was established to acknowledge exemplary performance by portfolio companies and their leaders. The selection process for the award, conducted by Montage Partners' culture committee, highlights companies that exemplify the firm's six core values - people, transparency, accountability, integrity, and mutual respect. This initiative aims to celebrate and commend outstanding commitment to these values within the company.

news.headline: T. Rowe Price Gr (NASDAQ:TROW) Q4 earnings released, missed estimates by -4.0%. Details on Benzinga.com.
news.summary: On Wednesday, February 5, 2025, at 07:00 AM, T. Rowe Price Gr (NASDAQ:TROW) released its Q4 earnings report. The company reported an EPS below estimates, missing by -4.0%. Further details can be found on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Seeking interest for loan debenture issuances for finance innovations. Join us for a new opportunity in financing.
E.W. Scripps (NASDAQ: SSP) to reveal Q4 2024 results on Feb. 27 after market close, conference call Feb. 28 at 9:30 a.m. ET.
news.summary: The E.W. Scripps Company, trading under NASDAQ: SSP, is set to announce its operating performance for the fourth quarter of 2024 after market hours on Thursday, February 27. A conference call involving the senior management team is scheduled for 9:30 a.m. Eastern time on Friday, February 28.

news.headline: Invivyd partners with Coach Jim Harbaugh to raise COVID-19 awareness, emphasizing risks to immunocompromised, through media initiatives.
news.summary: WALTHAM, Mass - On Feb. 5, 2025, Invivyd, Inc. (Nasdaq: IVVD) revealed a new alliance with professional football coach Jim Harbaugh to promote awareness on the current and future risks of COVID-19, particularly for the immunocompromised, and urge individuals to explore their available choices. The partnership aims to feature Coach Harbaugh in various live events and social media campaigns to reach a broad audience.

news.headline: Is Trump's presidency trapped in transitory uncertainty?
Don't overlook non-US equities, say experts despite record highs in US markets. Diversify for portfolio growth.
Nasdaq grants Beyond Air 180-day extension to meet minimum bid requirement, deadline extended to August 4, 2025.
news.summary: Beyond Air, Inc., a medical device and biopharmaceutical company trading on NASDAQ under the symbol XAIR, has been granted an extension until August 4, 2025, to meet Nasdaq's minimum bid price rule (Rule 5550(a)(2). The company announced the receipt of this notification, giving them an additional 180 days to regain compliance. This development will not impact the current trading status of Beyond Air's common stock on the Nasdaq Capital Market.

news.headline: WithSecure Corp to release Financial Statement & Annual Report of 2024 on Feb 12, 2025.
China wants to accelerate free-trade talks with South Korea.
Schweiger Dermatology Group named top in NY, NJ, PA & FL by Castle Connolly with 61 physicians as Top Doctors 2025.
news.summary: In New York on February 5, 2025, Schweiger Dermatology Group, a top provider of dermatology and allergy services, received a total of eight Accolades from Castle Connolly. These Accolades are granted to health systems, hospitals, and physician practices that demonstrate excellence in providing healthcare services.

news.headline: China is willing to strengthen high-level exchanges with South korea.
Chevron communicating with Trump admin regarding situation in Venezuela.
martini.ai introduces Agentic AI Company Research for instant credit insights on private companies.
news.summary: In Palo Alto, California, martini.ai introduces Agentic AI Company Research, providing an efficient and adaptable method for evaluating and overseeing credit risk among various private companies. This advanced tool aims to streamline the process and enhance scalability in assessing creditworthiness.
